Posts.Content: You are not being selfish! After everything you are being put through, to enjoy xmas with your family and some normality is understandable. I am facing similar situation. I was expecting surgery week before xmas, and I was in pieces when they told me. The thought of not being with my daughter xmas morning made me so upset. The hospital have been understanding and are happy for me to have the operation between xmas and new year. Only a weeks delay, but will make all the difference for me and my family!

Posts.Title: mastectomy date advice please

Posts.Content: So, was diagnosed with cancer in right breast back in July (and lymph node to right armpit). Caughted early so tumour was quite small. Start immediately with 6 week cycle of FEC, my last is next week...thank god! All the way through the process I’ve been told it’s small, it’s shrinking so surgery will be lumpectomy followed by radiotherapy.  I met the surgeon a couple of days ago to what I assumed was to confirm a surgery date and he drops to me that the consultants have decided I should now have full mastectomy, and they are advising to both breasts (apparently because Of my you he age - 33). He said I will undergo surgery 3 weeks from finishing chemo, so I’m 4 weeks I facing a full mastectomy yet ive not even had any arrangements made to even speak to a plastic surgeon. Seems like it’s all very last minute to me, should I be chasing this. I don’t even know what type of surgery they have planned! It’s all making me feel very anxious, especially with surgery likely being the week leading up to xmas. I will be so upset not to be with my husband and young daughter for xmas day :-(

Posts.Content: Thanks. I don’t think I want delays, just don’t know why I have had no contact from a plastic surgeon get, so I have time to digest my options?
